## **4.1 Getting Started**

Before we get started, we need to ensure that **GWmodel**, **sf**, **tmap** and **tidyverse** packages of R are currently installed in your R.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(sf, ggstatsplot, tmap, tidyverse, knitr,GWmodel)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hunan <- st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial", 
                 layer = "Hunan")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `Hunan' from data source 
  `C:\Users\jia_y\OneDrive - Singapore Management University\Semester 4\ISSS626-G1 Geo Spatial Analytics and Applications\jylau91\ISSS626-GAA\In-class_Ex\In-class_Ex04\data\geospatial' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 88 features and 7 fields
Geometry type: POLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 108.7831 ymin: 24.6342 xmax: 114.2544 ymax: 30.12812
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hunan2012 <- read_csv("data/aspatial/Hunan_2012.csv")
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hunan_sf <- left_join(hunan,hunan2012)%>%
  select(1:3, 7, 15, 16, 31, 32) #selecting columns 1:3,7,15...etc to remove unneeded data.
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hunan_sp <- hunan_sf %>%
  as_Spatial()
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
bw_CV <- bw.gwr(GDPPC ~ 1,
                data = hunan_sp,
                approach = "AIC",
                adaptive = TRUE,
                kernel = "bisquare",
                longlat = T)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Adaptive bandwidth (number of nearest neighbours): 62 AICc value: 1923.156 
Adaptive bandwidth (number of nearest neighbours): 46 AICc value: 1920.469 
Adaptive bandwidth (number of nearest neighbours): 36 AICc value: 1917.324 
Adaptive bandwidth (number of nearest neighbours): 29 AICc value: 1916.661 
Adaptive bandwidth (number of nearest neighbours): 26 AICc value: 1914.897 
Adaptive bandwidth (number of nearest neighbours): 22 AICc value: 1914.045 
Adaptive bandwidth (number of nearest neighbours): 22 AICc value: 1914.045 
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
bw_CV <- bw.gwr(GDPPC ~ 1,
                data = hunan_sp,
                approach = "CV",
                adaptive = TRUE,
                kernel = "bisquare",
                longlat = T)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Adaptive bandwidth: 22 CV score: 13662299974 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#bw_CV <- bw.gwr(GDPPC ~ 1,#calculate via a linear regression model. GDPPC is dependent variable, ` is independent variable "dummy ~ 1, i.e. correlation of 1 = same so that the model can run a regression model"`
```

:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
bw_CV <- bw.gwr(GDPPC ~ 1,
                data = hunan_sp,
                approach = "AIC",
                adaptive = FALSE,
                kernel = "bisquare",
                longlat = T)
```

```{.r .cell-code}
                data = hunan_sp,
                approach = "CV",
                adaptive = FALSE,
                kernel = "bisquare",
                longlat = T)
```

:::

```{.r .cell-code}
bw_CV
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 76.29126
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
bw_AIC <- bw.gwr(GDPPC ~ 1,
                data = hunan_sp,
                approach = "AIC",
                adaptive = TRUE,
                kernel = "bisquare",
                longlat = T)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Adaptive bandwidth (number of nearest neighbours): 62 AICc value: 1923.156 
Adaptive bandwidth (number of nearest neighbours): 46 AICc value: 1920.469 
Adaptive bandwidth (number of nearest neighbours): 36 AICc value: 1917.324 
Adaptive bandwidth (number of nearest neighbours): 29 AICc value: 1916.661 
Adaptive bandwidth (number of nearest neighbours): 26 AICc value: 1914.897 
Adaptive bandwidth (number of nearest neighbours): 22 AICc value: 1914.045 
Adaptive bandwidth (number of nearest neighbours): 22 AICc value: 1914.045 
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
gwstat <- gwss(data = hunan_sp,
               vars = "GDPPC",
               bw = bw_AIC,
               kernel = "bisquare",
               adaptive = TRUE,
               longlat = T)
```
:::



Code chunk below is used to extract SDF data table from gwss object output from gwss(). It will be converted into data.frame by using as.data.frame().



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
gwstat_df <- as.data.frame(gwstat$SDF)
```
:::



Next, cbind() is used to append the newly derived data.frame onto hunan_sf sf data.frame.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hunan_gstat <- cbind(hunan_sf, gwstat_df)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
basemap <- tm_shape(hunan) +
  tm_polygons() +
  tm_text("NAME_3", size=0.5)

gdppc <- qtm(hunan_gstat, "GDPPC") +
  tm_fill(palette=c("yellow", "orange", "red")) +
  tm_legend(position=c("left", "bottom"),
             text.size = 0.4,
            frame=FALSE)

tmap_arrange(gdppc, asp=1)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-15-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(hunan_gstat) +
  tm_fill("GDPPC_LM",
          n = 5,
          style = "quantile") +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +
  tm_layout(main.title = "Distribution of geographically weighted mean",
            main.title.position = "center",
            main.title.size = 1.0,
            legend.position = c("left","bottom"),
            legend.text.size = 0.5,
            legend.height = 1.50,
            legend.width = 1.50,
            frame = TRUE)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-16-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



Is there a relationship between GDP per capita and Gross Industry output?
